channel.title: Cycle Rate
channel.description: Would it be better if i changed my Cycle Rate to 474 instead of 600 or does that not make a difference?

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Damn, really? I’ll go change it back to 600 ms, I’ll be ready to observe any changes.

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Worse. Keep it at 600.

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Okay great. Thank you for letting me know. So would it be better or worse if i made it say 650 or 700 or would that not really do anything?

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Your entire engine must cycle at 600ms in a single-threaded server design. But in a multi-threaded server you could have a world updater which updated players and npcs at intervals of 600ms, while another thread handled networking at intervals of 50ms to allow for faster networking (aka logging in would occur quicker) for example.

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:9, topic:422717”][quote author=FlameTM link=topic=525380.msg3824943#msg3824943 date=1322094738]

[quote author=NotLikingThis link=topic=525380.msg3824942#msg3824942 date=1322094572]
Could that also result in a memory leak as well?
[/quote] Yes.
[/quote] No.

The Runescape client is timed to receive updates at intervals of 600ms ticks. Running your server at intervals of faster or slower than 600ms will result in a less smooth effect. Your walking and and local player updating will be off and people will appear to be warping vs walking. So while setting your cycle to 500ms is a bad idea, setting it at 474ms is even worse![/quote]
Yay I knew it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“FlameTM, post:8, topic:422717”][quote author=NotLikingThis link=topic=525380.msg3824942#msg3824942 date=1322094572]
Could that also result in a memory leak as well?
[/quote] Yes.[/quote] No.

The Runescape client is timed to receive updates at intervals of 600ms ticks. Running your server at intervals of faster or slower than 600ms will result in a less smooth effect. Your walking and and local player updating will be off and people will appear to be warping vs walking. So while setting your cycle to 500ms is a bad idea, setting it at 474ms is even worse!

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“NotLikingThis, post:7, topic:422717”]Could that also result in a memory leak as well?[/quote] Yes.

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

I set my cycle at 500 ms. It shouldn’t really matter, but if the process cycles quickly, you may possibly use more memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

Ohhh okay. Thank you for your help. He said his has been running smoothly on 474 and i just wanted to make sure it was the right thing to do.
EDIT: So should i keep it at 600 or make it higher then that?

Read full topic

item.title: Cycle Rate
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Not necessarily. Means all the processes will be called quicker, and if those processes are useless shit, then it wouldn’t run more smoothly.

Read full topic
